revised_title: Air Resistance on Projectiles at High Velocities: Experiments up to 4500 Feet per Second
tldr: The author investigates the effect of air resistance on projectiles traveling at high velocities, up to 4500 feet per second. The experiments were conducted using a ballistic pendulum and various bullets, with results showing that air resistance is significant even at high speeds and can be approximated by an empirical formula.
